info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:18PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Moffat County through 245 PM MDT... At 218 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 25 miles west of Craig, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lay, Maybell and Juniper Springs. This includes U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 60 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
